work.name: Princeton University Department of Physics
work.summary: Working on the SPIDER and Taurus experiments
highlights: Pointing reconstruction for SPIDER-2 using CMB intensity fluctuations
Characterization of pointing errors using compact source statistics
Understanding scan synchronous noise
Development of data quality flags and statistics
Determination of primary calibration and instrument parameters through CMB cross-correlation
SPIDER-2 integration and testing campaigns: Winter 2022-23 McMurdo Antarctica, Summer 2021 Palestine TX, Spring 2020 Princeton NJ
Tested various SPIDER-2 pointing strategies
Development of spectral domain component separation pipeline
Created unique divisions of the SPIDER sky and probed for correlations in existing cosmological data
Implementation and calibration of cryogenic housekeeping instrumentation
Mechanical design, testing, and assembly of flight photovoltaic arrays
Development and implementation of flight data storage system
Investigation of efficient, cryogenic filters for mitigation of RFI

work.name: University of Oslo Bayesian Cosmological Data Analysis Course
work.summary: Learning to use Commander 3, an end-to-end Bayesian parameter estimator that combines data from multiple experiments
highlights: Applied SPIDER-1 data at the map level to Commander 3

work.name: Ohio State University Department of Physics
work.summary: Working on the Askaryan Radio Array (ARA)
highlights: Wrote a genetic algorithm to calibrate SURF data from Stanford Linear Accelerator Center (SLAC)
Wrote genetic algorithms to evolve wire antennas using gain and neutrino shower simulation software
Development of Askaryan Radio Array (ARA) hardware, firmware, and integration
Wrote genetic algorithms to fit spherical harmonic coefficients, generating directional antenna gain patterns

work.name: Big Data Analytics Project
work.summary: Helped create a new class, “Big Data” Analytics in Physics 6820
highlights: Documented here: www.github.com/SummerBigData

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography
